item.title: Vanessa add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life is pain, highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something." -- William Goldman

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Good night, Westley. Good work. Sleep well. I'll most likely kill you in the morning." -- William Goldman

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "She was fascinated with words. To her, words were things of beauty, each like a magical powder or potion that could be combined with other words to create powerful spells." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "The heart is an artist that paints over what profoundly disturbs it, leaving on the canvas a less dark, less sharp version of the truth." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Given my heritage and the ordeal of my childhood, I sometimes wonder why I myself am not insane. Maybe I am." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Change isn't easy. Changing the way you live means changing the way you think, means changing what you believe about life. That's hard." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "When we make our own misery we sometimes cling to it even when we want so bad to change, because misery is something we know. The misery is comfortable." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "She lived for others, her heart tuned to their anguish and their needs." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Dean R. Koontz
item.description: "There are days when it seems to me that in literature the most convincing depiction of the world in which we live is to be found in the phantasmagorical kingdom through which Lewis Carroll took Alice on a tour." -- Dean R. Koontz

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The road to hell is paved with adverbs." -- Stephen King

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Good books don't give up all their secrets at once." -- Stephen King

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Robert Bloch
item.description: "Despite my ghoulish reputation, I really have the heart of a small boy. I keep it in a jar on my desk." -- Robert Bloch

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Humor is almost always anger with its make-up on." -- Stephen King

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "It is the tale, not he who tells it." -- Stephen King

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Life isn't a support system for art. It's the other way around." -- Stephen King

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Stuff your eyes with wonder, he said, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "We are cups, constantly and quietly being filled. The trick is, knowing how to tip ourselves over and let the beautiful stuff out." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "We need not to be let alone. We need to be really bothered once in a while. How long is it since you were really bothered? About something important, about something real?" -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Don't think. Thinking is the enemy of creativity. It's self-conscious and anything self-conscious is lousy. You can't "try" to do things. You simply "must" do things." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "The magic is only in what books say, how they stitched the patches of the universe together into one garment for us." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: "It's gonna go wrong." Or "She's going to hurt me." Or,"I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . ." Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Find out what your hero or heroine wants, and when he or she wakes up in the morning, just follow him or her all day.." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Oh, what strange wonderful clocks women are. They nest in Time. They make the flesh that holds fast and binds eternity. They live inside the gift, know power, accept, and need not mention it. Why speak of time when you are Time, and shape the universal moments, as they pass, into warmth and action?" -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "The good writers touch life often. The mediocre ones run a quick hand over her. The bad ones rape her and leave her for the flies." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Your intuition knows what to write, so get out of the way." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "What's the point of having a library full of books you've already read?" -- Ray Bradbury
